Author.contactName: LIGO Scientific Collaboration and Virgo Collaboration

Param.name: Packet_Type
Param.Description: The Notice Type number is assigned/used within GCN, eg type=150 is an LVC_PRELIMINARY notice

Param.name: internal
Param.Description: Indicates whether this event should be distributed to LSC/Virgo members only

Param.name: Pkt_Ser_Num
Param.Description: A number that increments by 1 each time a new revision is issued for this event

Param.name: GraceID
Param.Description: Identifier in GraceDB

Param.name: AlertType
Param.Description: VOEvent alert type

Param.name: HardwareInj
Param.Description: Indicates that this event is a hardware injection if 1, no if 0

Param.name: OpenAlert
Param.Description: Indicates that this event is an open alert if 1, no if 0

Param.name: EventPage
Param.Description: Web page for evolving status of this GW candidate

Param.name: Instruments
Param.Description: List of instruments used in analysis to identify this event

Param.name: FAR
Param.Description: False alarm rate for GW candidates with this strength or greater

Param.name: Group
Param.Description: Data analysis working group

Param.name: Pipeline
Param.Description: Low-latency data analysis pipeline

Param.name: Search
Param.Description: Specific low-latency search

Param.name: skymap_fits
Param.Description: Sky Map FITS

Group.name: Classification

Param.name: BNS
Param.Description: Probability that the source is a binary neutron star merger (both objects lighter than 3 solar masses)

Param.name: NSBH
Param.Description: Probability that the source is a neutron star-black hole merger (primary heavier than 5 solar masses, secondary lighter than 3 solar masses)

Param.name: BBH
Param.Description: Probability that the source is a binary black hole merger (both objects heavier than 5 solar masses)

Param.name: MassGap
Param.Description: Probability that the source has at least one object between 3 and 5 solar masses

Param.name: Terrestrial
Param.Description: Probability that the source is terrestrial (i.e., a background noise fluctuation or a glitch)

Group.Description: Source classification: binary neutron star (BNS), neutron star-black hole (NSBH), binary black hole (BBH), MassGap, or terrestrial (noise)

Group.name: Properties

Param.name: HasNS
Param.Description: Probability that at least one object in the binary has a mass that is less than 3 solar masses

Param.name: HasRemnant
Param.Description: Probability that a nonzero mass was ejected outside the central remnant object

Group.Description: Qualitative properties of the source, conditioned on the assumption that the signal is an astrophysical compact binary merger

voe:VOEvent.Description: Report of a candidate gravitational wave event

How.Description: Candidate gravitational wave event identified by low-latency analysis
V1: Virgo 3 km gravitational wave detector
H1: LIGO Hanford 4 km gravitational wave detector
